results.headline: A Tender Heart in Stretchy Pants and Ankle Boots in 'Nacho Libre'

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Nacho Libre

results.summary_short: In his endearingly ridiculous new comedy, Jack Black plays a half-Mexican, half-Scandinavian monastery cook from Oaxaca who moonlights as a masked wrestler.

results.headline: Crossword Puzzles and the People Who Live Them in 'Wordplay'

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Wordplay

results.summary_short: Patrick Creadon's documentary offers a rare glimpse into the obsessive world of crossword puzzle composers and solvers.

results.headline: One Man, Up Close and Personal, in 'Uncut'

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Uncut

results.summary_short: Here is the longest filmed shot of a penis in the history of cinema, 76 explicit minutes that reveal little about men or their members.

results.headline: 'The Outside': A Portrait of the Director James Toback

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Outsider

results.summary_short: Nicholas Jarecki's documentary about James Toback is a tragically missed opportunity to illuminate one of the more unusual cinematic talents working today.

results.headline: A Life Lacks Spark in 'The Mostly Unfabulous Social Life of Ethan Green'
results.display_title: The Mostly Unfabulous Social Life of Ethan Green

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Mostly Unfabulous Social Life of Ethan Green

results.summary_short: George Bamber's frothy adaptation of Eric Orner's popular gay-themed comic strip never rises above sitcom level.

results.headline: In 'Lower City,' a Love Triangle With Soft Edges

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Lower City

results.summary_short: While this Brazilian drama turns out to be a predictable and somewhat sentimental lower-depths love triangle, Alice Braga gives a tough, candid performance that almost makes it work.

results.headline: A Motherly Love So Strong It Delights, Then Frightens, in 'Loverboy'

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Loverboy

results.summary_short: "Loverboy," the shaky second feature directed by Kevin Bacon, stars Kyra Sedgwick as a single mother whose possessive instinct runs amok.

results.headline: Keanu Reeves and Sandra Bullock Are Reunited in 'The Lake House'

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Lake House

results.summary_short: There is still chemistry between Sandra Bullock and Keanu Reeves, but a heavy dose of Hollywood metaphysics keeps them apart for most of this wondrously illogical time-travel romance.

results.headline: 'Only Human' Presents a Twist on Meeting the Parents

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Only Human

results.summary_short: This vigorously paced modern screwball comedy explores family values with a refreshingly light touch.

results.headline: An Overweight Tabby in London in 'Garfield: A Tale of Two Kitties'
results.byline: As Told to MANOHLA DARGIS by LORD DARGIS
results.display_title: Garfield: A Tail of Two Kitties

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Garfield: A Tail of Two Kitties

results.summary_short: In the second "Garfield" movie, the indignities are as enormous as the food bills.

results.headline: Another Round of Vehicular Mayhem in 'The Fast and the Furious: Tokyo Drift'
results.display_title: The Fast and the Furious: Tokyo Drift

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Fast and the Furious: Tokyo Drift

results.summary_short: The "Fast and Furious" formula (dudes + cars + babes = $) gets recycled in Tokyo, where the cars are smaller, the clothes are kookier, but the boys are still boys.

results.headline: Meet the New Boss, Once Again, in 'Land of the Blind'

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Land of the Blind

results.summary_short: Robert Edward's satirical allegory shamelessly borrows ideas from Orwell's "1984," then tramples them into the dust.

results.headline: 'Going Under': My Fair Dominatrix, a Love Story

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Going Under

results.summary_short: A married therapist (Roger Rees) and his dominatrix (Geno Lechner) attempt a real-world romance with predictably strained results.

results.headline: 'A/K/A Tommy Chong,' a Documentary About the Comedian and the Law

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of a/k/a Tommy Chong

results.summary_short: Josh Gilbert's film tells the depressing, often ridiculous and generally enraging story of how and why Tommy Chong ended up doing time in a minimum-security prison.

results.headline: Altman's Casual Chaos Meets Keillor's Rhubarb-Tinged Nostalgia in 'A Prairie Home Companion'

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of A Prairie Home Companion

results.summary_short: A late, minor addition to the Robert Altman collection — but a treasure all the same — "A Prairie Home Companion" is more likely to inspire fondness than awe.

results.headline: 'Crossing the Bridge' Is a Musical Tour of Turkey With a Funky Guide
results.display_title: Crossing the Bridge--The Sound of Istanbul

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Crossing the Bridge--The Sound of Istanbul

results.summary_short: An infectiously enjoyable survey of contemporary Turkish music, Fatih Akin's documentary works as a corollary to his breakout fiction film, "Head-On."

results.headline: 'El Perro' Brings Good Luck in Hard Times

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Bombon - El Perro

results.summary_short: "El Perro" is a lovely, rugged neo-realist fable from Argentina about a man and a dog.

results.headline: Lost Souls on the Open Highway in 'Slow Jam King'

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Slow Jam King

results.summary_short: A trio of lost souls take a road trip from New York to Nashville in this example of do-it-yourself filmmaking at its purest.

results.headline: 'The Heart of the Game' Chronicles the Sweat of Girls' Basketball, the Roar of the Coach

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Heart of the Game

results.summary_short: The hoop dreams of the teenage girls in the documentary "The Heart of the Game" are fairly straightforward if a wee bit intense.

results.headline: 'Cars' Is a Drive Down a Lonely Highway

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Cars

results.summary_short: Both in its ingratiating vibe and bland execution, "Cars" just putt, putt, putts along, a shining model of technological progress and consumer safety.
